cards.name: Feel My Pain
cards.text: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] and you get + [willpower] for each horror on you. If successful, you may heal 2 horror to have this attack deal +2 damage.

cards.name: Guiding Sprite
cards.text: You get +1 [willpower]. Play Guiding Sprite under the control of an investigator at a different location. Forced - At the end of your turn: Move once towards the investigator who played this card. If you enter that investigator's location, return Guiding Sprite to their hand.

cards.name: Coils of Oblivion
cards.text: [action] Place 1 doom on Coils of Oblivion: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] At the beginning of your turn: Remove 1 doom from Coils of Oblivion.

cards.name: Coils of Oblivion
cards.text: [action] Place 1 doom on Coils of Oblivion: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] At the beginning of your turn: Remove 1 doom from Coils of Oblivion.

cards.name: Malfeasance
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Heal 1 horror from each investigator at your location. Add a [curse] token to the chaos bag for each horror healed this way.

cards.name: Deadman's Deal
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
When you would reveal a chaos tokens for this skill test, search the bag for a [bless] token. If there is one, resolve that token as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag. Then, when you would reveal the next token, search the bag for a [curse] token. If there is one, resolve that token as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag.

cards.name: Destiny Darkens
cards.text: When you commit Destiny Darkens to a skill test, choose an Ally or Item asset in your play area. Destiny Darkens gains + [willpower] for each doom on that card. If this skill test is successful, you may remove a doom from that asset. If this skill test fails, add a doom to that asset.

cards.name: Prophesy
cards.text: While there are 3 or more doom in play, Prophesy gains [wild]. While there are 6 or more doom in play, Prophesy gains [wild] [wild], instead. While there are 9 or more doom in play, Prophesy gains [wild] [wild] [wild], instead.

cards.name: Feel My Pain
cards.text: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] and you get + [willpower] for each horror on you. If successful, you may heal 1 horror to have this attack deal +1 damage.

cards.name: Data Doping
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Data Doping: Seal a [curse] token from the chaos bag on this card. Then, heal 1 horror. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there are any [curse] tokens sealed on Data Doping: Test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of [curse] tokens sealed on this card. If you fail, release all tokens sealed on Data Doping and discard it.

cards.name: Dance with the Devil
cards.text: Parley. Place a doom on a non-Elite enemy at your location and test [willpower] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight value. You get + [willpower] for each doom on that enemy. If you succeed, discard the chosen enemy from play.

cards.name: Tamed Kaiju
cards.text: [action] Deal 1 horror to Tamed Kaiju: Fight. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Unstable Puzzlebox
cards.text: If there is an even amount of doom on Unstable Puzzlebox, it does not count towards the agenda. [action] Place 1 doom on Unstable Puzzlebox: Investigate. This investigation uses [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +1 [willpower] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue.

cards.name: Group Therapy
cards.text: Heal 3 horror from among investigators at your location. Each investigator who healed horror this way may draw a card.

cards.name: Unstable Puzzlebox
cards.text: If there is an even amount of doom on Unstable Puzzlebox, it does not count towards the agenda. [action] Place 1 doom on Unstable Puzzlebox: Investigate. This investigation uses [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed and there are 3 or more doom on this card, discover 1 additional clue.

cards.name: Prepare the Offering
cards.text: Fast. Choose an Ally or Item asset in your play area. You may move any amount of doom on cards in your play area to that card.

cards.name: Astral Connection
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You have 1 additional ally slot. [action] Play an Ally asset in your discard pile. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Move 1 doom from the current agenda to an Ally or Item asset in your play area. (Group limit twice per game.)

cards.name: Sorrow Feeder
cards.text: You get +1 [willpower]. Sorrow Feeder enters play with 1 horror on it. Forced - At the start of your turn: Heal 1 horror from Sorrow Feeder. If you cannot, discard this card from play.

cards.name: Vice or Virtue
cards.text: Commit only to a skill test you are performing that has no other cards committed to it. If this test is successful, add 3 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If this test fails, add 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.name: Penance
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Deal 1 damage to each investigator at your location. Add 2 [bless] token to the chaos bag for each damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Rallying Cry
cards.text: One at a time, you may move each other investigator and non-Elite enemy once towards your location.

cards.name: Robust
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, heal 1 damage.

cards.name: Emergency Portal
cards.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to your location. Any investigator may treat this location as if it were connected to their location while moving. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Discard this card from play.

cards.name: Intrepid
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, attach Intrepid to your location. Investigators at a location with Intrepid get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1[agility]. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Intrepid.

cards.name: Penance
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Deal 1 damage to each investigator at your location. Add a [bless] token to the chaos bag for each damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Painpeel Katana
cards.text: [action] Fight. You get +X [combat] and deal +X damage, where X is the amount of damage on this card. If this attack defeats an enemy, you may place 1 damage on this card.

cards.name: Share Your Faith
cards.text:
Seal (up to 3 [bless]). If Share Your Faith has no tokens sealed on it, discard it.

[action] Return a chaos token sealed on this card to the token pool. Investigators at your location gain a total of 3 resources, distributed as you wish.

cards.name: Arrest Warrant
cards.text: Fast. Attach to any non-Elite enemy in play. [reaction] After an investigator defeats this enemy: They may gain resources equal to this enemy's health.

cards.name: Bodyguard
cards.text: You get +1 [combat] for each damage on Bodyguard.

cards.name: Deadman's Deal
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
When you would reveal a chaos tokens for this skill test, search the bag for a [bless] token. If there is one, resolve that token as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: "That's the worst reason for a warrant that I've ever heard. Well, what are we waiting for?"
cards.name: "I've got a warrant!"
cards.text: Investigate. This investigation uses [combat] and gets -1 difficulty for each Ally asset in your play area. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

cards.flavor: "You won't believe how much this costs!"
cards.name: Golden Fleece
cards.text: [action]: Gain a resource for each damage on Golden Fleece.

cards.name: Probable Cause
cards.text: [reaction] When an enemy or investigator performs an attack at a different location, exhaust Probable Cause: Move once towards that location before resolving the attack.

cards.name: Rallying Cry
cards.text: One at a time, you may move each other investigator and non-Elite enemy to your location.

cards.name: Search and Seizure
cards.text:
Attach to your location.

Attached location gains: [reaction] After an investigator successfully investigates this location, they may gain 1 resource and draw 1 card. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.name: Side-by-Side
cards.text: Side-by-Side gains [willpower] [combat] for each investigator at your location.

cards.name: Small Bribe
cards.text:
Choose two (this action does not provoke attacks of oppertunity):

<hs><bul> Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your <hs><hs>location.

<hs><bul> Discover 1 clue at your location.

<hs><bul> Draw a card.

cards.name: Annihilation Dial
cards.text:
[reaction] When 1 or more [bless] or [curse] tokens would be removed from the chaos bag during a skill test: Seal them on Annihilation Dial, instead.

[reaction] When you would draw the top card of the encounter deck, return 3 [bless] or [curse] tokens (or any combination) sealed on Annihilation Dial to the token pool: Draw a card from your deck instead.

cards.name: Painpeel Katana
cards.text: [action] Fight. You get +X [combat] and deal +X damage, where X is the amount of damage on this card. If this attack defeats an enemy, place 1 damage on this card.

cards.name: How to Hightail
cards.text: Heidi Hightail deck only. [reaction] After a non-Elite enemy spawns engaged with you, exhaust How to Hightail: Evade. If you succeed, instead of evading the enemy, disengage from it and move to a connecting location.

cards.name: Survey Drone
cards.text: Permanent. Trix Bellix deck only. [free] If Survey Drone is in your play area: Attach Survey Drone to any revealed location or non-Elite enemy. While Trix is attacking or investigating, attached location gets -1 shroud and attached enemies get -1 fight. [reaction] After the last clue is discovered at the attached location or the attached enemy leaves play: Return Survey Drone to Trix Bellix's play area.

cards.name: A Costly Thing
cards.text:
Sprock Vilewire deck only.
Doom on A Costly Thing does not count towards the agenda's doom threshhold.

[reaction] After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a test you are performing: Move a doom from an asset in your play area to A Costly Thing.

cards.name: Barefoot
cards.text: Revelation - Put Barefoot into play in your threat area. Forced - After you move: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you cannot move for the rest of the round. [reaction] After moving 3 times in a single turn: Discard Barefoot.

cards.name: Photonic Shotseeker
cards.text:
Dom Darkdata deck only. Uses (2 ammo).
[action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

[reaction] At the end of your turn, if there is at least 1 [bless] and 1 [curse] token sealed on Photonic Shotseeker: Place 1 ammo on this card.

cards.name: Curse of the Cyberdragon
cards.text: Revelation - Return 3 [bless] or [curse] tokens (or any combination) sealed on assets in your play area to the token pool. If you cannot, take 1 horror for each token you were unable to return to the token pool.

cards.name: Organic Thoughts
cards.text: Revelation - Put Organic Thoughts into play in your threat area. You cannot trigger [free] or [reaction] actions. [action] [action] Discard Organic Thoughts.

cards.name: Creator's Gift
cards.text: P.O.P.S. deck only. You have two additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold Weapon assets. [free] Exhaust Creator's Gift: Choose a Weapon card in your discard pile and shuffle it into your deck.

cards.name: Flexible
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, gain 2 resources.

cards.name: Caught Dark-Handed
cards.text: Revelation - For each asset in your play area with doom, choose and either discard that asset or take 1 horror. If there are no assets with doom in your play area, shuffle Caught Dark-Handed back into your deck.

cards.name: Unruly Drone
cards.text: Revelation - Put Unruly Drone into play in your threat area. Move Survey Drone to the location with the most clues or the non-elite enemy with the most remaining health. If there are no clues or enemies in play, shuffle Unruly Drone back into your deck. Survey Drone now increases the shroud and fight on attached cards by +1 instead of reducing them. [reaction] After Survey Drone returns to Trix Bellix's play area: Discard Unruly Drone.

cards.back_flavor: Dom Darkdata returned from the eternal war with more mental scars than physical ones. When he enlisted, the High Legion showed him holotapes of the Savage Lands: cyberwear ripped from the living, villages drowned in antimatter, unbridled chaos. They were savagesthats what he was told. It made it easier to pull the trigger. Then an artillery failure left him badly injured and stranded in the Savage Lands. When he woke, a savage girl was tending to his wounds. She seemed harmlessuntil she wasnt. When Dom tried to leave, she jacked a corruption drive into his neck, infecting him with a virus that cuts through High Legion software. Now reality shifts around him, revealing the holotapes were doctored and the war built on lies. The girls last look haunts himnot scared, but knowing. He was the one afraid as he pulled the trigger. After saying goodbye to the Savage Lands, Dom began working as a corporate fixer, taking dirty jobs to scrape together enough credits to afford surgery to purge the virus from his head. He blitzes every night to forget, but the corruption lingersboth in his system and in his soul.
cards.back_text: Deck Size 30.\nDeckbuilding Options Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-4, Blessed cards level 0-3, Cursed cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5.\nDeckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Photonic Shotseeker, Curse of the Cyberdragon, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "I sold my soul, but I can buy it back."
cards.name: Dom Darkdata
cards.text:
[free] During your turn: Seal a [bless] or [curse] token on an asset you control. (Limit once per round.)

[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token during a skill test on an asset you control: Resolve a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on that asset instead. Return that token to the token pool. (Limit once per test.)

[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, add 1 [bless] and 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.

cards.back_flavor: Trix Bellix grew up with their hands in the trash. With no family or credits to speak for, Trix spent their youth fumbling through scrap and spare parts building thousands of junkbots to carry out little tasks. Trix lived in peace, bothering no one until one of their survey drones saw something it shouldn't. It recorded the Captain of Sparkham City's High Legionaries playing hide the datachips with a Class 6 Pleasure Bot. Now Captain Kreel has half of the city's peace force scanning for Trix and deleting anyone who gets in their way.
cards.back_text: Deck Size 30.\nDeckbuilding Options Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-4, Tool cards level 0-3, Trap cards level 0-3, Trick cards level 0-3, and Neutral cards level 0-5.\nDeckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size) Survey Drone, Unruly Drone, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Trix Bellix
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate a location with 0 shroud: Discover an additional clue at that location. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After you successfully attack a non-Elite enemy with 0 fight: Deal +1 damage. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +0. If you are performing a skill test against a card with Survey Drone attached, apply -3 to that test's difficulty instead of -1.

cards.back_flavor: POPS, or Personal Operating Pal/Slave, was once a cutting-edge android, but over the years, newer models replaced him and forced POPS to join the brutal robot fighting leagues. After years of breaking down his fellow robots for the entertainment of bloodthirsty crowds, POPS attempted to lead a rebellion with his fellow robots. However, the rebellion was quickly squashed, his allies were either captured or reprogrammed, and POPS barely escaped, badly broken. Now, haunted by the memory of his fallen comrades and the actions he took in the arena, POPS roams Sparkham City, determined to rebuild himself and form an army. Scarred by years of forced combat, he vows to return to the arena not as a fighter, but as a liberatorto free his allies and destroy the system that enslaved them.
cards.back_text: Deck Size 30.\nDeckbuilding Options Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-4, Weapon cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5.\nDeckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size) Creator's Gift, Organic Thoughts, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "I got a few dings and dents. Who don't?"
cards.name: P.O.P.S.
cards.text: [reaction] When you perform a fight action, discard a Weapon asset from your hand or play area: This attack deals +1 damage. If you discarded a card in you play area, you get +1 [combat] for this attack. (Limit once per turn.) [elder_sign] effect: +1. If you succeed, you may play an asset from your hand, reducing its resource cost by 1.

cards.back_flavor: Heidi Hightail thought she could have it all. The money. The mansions. 5 trillion subscribers. It was all possible through her holofans account. All she had to do post. It didnt matter if she talking about essential oils for your homebots or dancing to the newest synth, everything she posted earned her more followers. She didn't mind her holofans following her everywhere she went at first. Heidi adored the attention and celebrity. Things changed when she woke in the middle of the night and saw a single holofan watching her from the corner of her room. She wasn't even streaming, but there he was. Just watching her without saying a word. Needless to say, Heidi hightailed it out of there and has been running ever since. But no matter how far Heidi runs, her holofans are never far behind.
cards.back_text: Deck Size 30.\nDeckbuilding Options Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-4, cards that "move" investigators or enemies level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5.\nDeckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size) How to Hightail, Barefoot, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Heidi Hightail
cards.text:
[free] If there are no enemies or treacheries in your threat area: Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)

[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this test is successful, you may disengage from all enemies and move to a connecting location.

cards.back_flavor: Sprock Vilewire owes an impossible debt. Working as an arms dealer in the Darkmarket, she quickly amassed a small fortune and a name for herself as a ruthless negotiator. However, things went south after Sprock sold a defective anti-matter drive that malfunctioned and left a starship full of children irradiated when the engine exploded. Sprock lost everything and went on the run as most of Sparkham City wants her dead including her former boss at the Darkmarket. Now desperate, Sprock sells whatever she can in hopes of earning enough credits to escape the city alive.
cards.back_text: Deck Size 30.\nDeckbuilding Options Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-4, Illicit cards level 0-3, Favor cards level 0-3, Gambit cards level 0-3, and Neutral cards level 0-5.\nDeckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size) A Costly Thing, Caught Dark-Handed, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Sprock Vilewire
cards.text: [free] During your turn, discard an Item asset in your play area with 3 or more doom on it: Gain resources equal to the amount of doom on that card. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: (Either) +2. Add a doom to an Item asset in your play area. or -2. You may remove a doom from an Item asset in your play area.
